conclusion: Conveyor belt speed is 6 m/s, distance between wheels M and N is 10 m, object mass is 3 kg, coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.3, and gravity is 10 m/s².
Object is gently placed on the conveyor belt directly above wheel M, starting with zero velocity relative to the ground.
Kinetic friction force will act on the object to accelerate it to the belt's speed.
Normal force N is equal to the weight of the object, N = m * g = 30 N.
Frictional force f = μ * N = 9 N.
Frictional force acts in the direction of the conveyor belt's motion.
Acceleration of the object due to frictional force a = f / m = 3 m/s².
Using kinematic equation, distance s covered while accelerating to belt's speed is 6 m.
Object accelerates for 6 meters and then moves at constant speed for the remaining 4 meters.
Frictional force only acts during acceleration phase, not during constant velocity phase.
Work done by frictional force during acceleration phase is W = f * d = 54 J.
No work is done during constant velocity phase as there's no relative motion.
Total work done by friction is 54 J.
